edu.buffalo.cse.ir.wikiindexer.tokenizer
Class TokenStream

java.lang.Object
  edu.buffalo.cse.ir.wikiindexer.tokenizer.TokenStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>
public class TokenStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

This class represents a stream of tokens as the name suggests. It wraps the token stream and provides utility methods to manipulate it

Author:
nikhillo

 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getTokenMap()
          Method to retrieve a map of token to count mapping This map should contain the unique set of tokens as keys The values should be the number of occurrences of the token in the given stream

Method Detail

append

public void append(java.lang.String... tokens)
Method to append tokens to the stream

Parameters:
tokens: - The tokens to be appended

getTokenMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getTokenMap()
Method to retrieve a map of token to count mapping This map should contain the unique set of tokens as keys The values should be the number of occurrences of the token in the given stream

Returns:
The map as described above, no restrictions on ordering applicable

getAllTokens

public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getAllTokens()
Method to get the underlying token stream as a collection of tokens

Returns:
A collection containing the ordered tokens as wrapped by this stream Each token must be a separate element within the collection. Operations on the returned collection should NOT affect the token stream

query

public int query(java.lang.String token)
Method to query for the given token within the stream

Parameters:
token: - The token to be queried

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Iterator method: Method to check if the stream has any more tokens

Specified by:
hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>
Returns:
true if a token exists to iterate over, false otherwise

hasPrevious

public boolean hasPrevious()
Iterator method: Method to check if the stream has any more tokens

Returns:
true if a token exists to iterate over, false otherwise

next

public java.lang.String next()
Iterator method: Method to get the next token from the stream Callers must call the set method to modify the token, changing the value of the token returned by this method must not alter the stream

Specified by:
next in interface java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>
Returns:
The next token from the stream, null if at the end

previous

public java.lang.String previous()
Iterator method: Method to get the previous token from the stream Callers must call the set method to modify the token, changing the value of the token returned by this method must not alter the stream

Returns:
The next token from the stream, null if at the end

remove

public void remove()
Iterator method: Method to remove the current token from the stream

Specified by:
remove in interface java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

mergeWithPrevious

public boolean mergeWithPrevious()
Method to merge the current token with the previous token, assumes whitespace separator between tokens when merged. The token iterator should now point to the newly merged token (i.e. the previous one)

Returns:
true if the merge succeeded, false otherwise

mergeWithNext

public boolean mergeWithNext()
Method to merge the current token with the next token, assumes whitespace separator between tokens when merged. The token iterator should now point to the newly merged token (i.e. the current one)

Returns:
true if the merge succeeded, false otherwise

set

public void set(java.lang.String... newValue)
Method to replace the current token with the given tokens The stream should be manipulated accordingly based upon the number of tokens set It is expected that remove will be called to delete a token instead of passing null or an empty string here. The iterator should point to the last set token, i.e, last token in the passed array.

Parameters:
newValue: - The array of new values with every new token as a separate element within the array

reset

public void reset()
Iterator method: Method to reset the iterator to the start of the stream next must be called to get a token

seekEnd

public void seekEnd()
Iterator method: Method to set the iterator to beyond the last token in the stream previous must be called to get a token

merge

public void merge(TokenStream other)
Method to merge this stream with another stream

Parameters:
other: - The stream to be merged
